com.konakart.app

Class Option

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.konakart.app.Option
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionIf

    public class Option
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptionIf
    A product contains an array of these option objects. An option is used to configure a product and may change the price of a product. i.e. The amount of memory or CPU specification for a personal computer.

      • getType

        public int getType()
        The type of option. Valid types are
        • TYPE_SIMPLE - Standard type where the option may or may not change the price of the product.
        • TYPE_VARIABLE_QUANTITY - A quantity may be defined for the option (i.e. Number of megabytes). The price defined will be multiplied by the quantity since it is a unit price.
        • TYPE_CUSTOMER_PRICE - A customer may enter the price for the option. Can be used for donations.
        • TYPE_CUSTOMER_TEXT - A customer may enter text for the option to personalize a product.
        Specified by:
        getType in interface OptionIf
        Returns:
        the type

      • setType

        public void setType(int type)
        The type of option. Valid types are
        • TYPE_SIMPLE - Standard type where the option may or may not change the price of the product.
        • TYPE_VARIABLE_QUANTITY - A quantity may be defined for the option (i.e. Number of megabytes). The price defined will be multiplied by the quantity since it is a unit price.
        • TYPE_CUSTOMER_PRICE - A customer may enter the price for the option. Can be used for donations.
        • TYPE_CUSTOMER_TEXT - A customer may enter text for the option to personalize a product.
        Specified by:
        setType in interface OptionIf
        Parameters:
        type - the type to set

      • getQuantity

        public int getQuantity()
        Only applicable in the case where the option is of type TYPE_VARIABLE_QUANTITY. In this case a quantity may be defined for the option which will be multiplied by the unit price in order to calculate the total option price.
        Specified by:
        getQuantity in interface OptionIf
        Returns:
        the quantity

      • setQuantity

        public void setQuantity(int quantity)
        Only applicable in the case where the option is of type TYPE_VARIABLE_QUANTITY. In this case a quantity may be defined for the option which will be multiplied by the unit price in order to calculate the total option price.
        Specified by:
        setQuantity in interface OptionIf
        Parameters:
        quantity - the quantity to set

      • getCustomerPrice

        public java.math.BigDecimal getCustomerPrice()
        Only applicable in the case where the option is of type TYPE_CUSTOMER_PRICE. In this case the customer may define the price of the option. An example of where this functionality may be useful is for donations.
        Specified by:
